verses.verse: A wise <S%H2450><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> [accepts his] father's discipline, <S%H4148><s%> But a scoffer <S%H9238><s%> does not listen <S%H8085><s%> to rebuke. <S%H1606><s%>
From the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of a man's mouth <S%H6310><s%> he enjoys <S%H398><s%> good, <S%H9185><s%> But the desire <S%H5315><s%> of the treacherous <S%H898><s%> is violence. <S%H2555><s%>

The one who guards <S%H5341><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> preserves <S%H8104><s%> his life; <S%H5315><s%> The one who opens <S%H6589><s%> wide <S%H6589><s%> his lips <S%H8193><s%> comes to ruin. <S%H4288><s%>

The soul <S%H5315><s%> of the sluggard <S%H6102><s%> craves <S%H183><s%> and [gets] nothing, <S%H369><s%> But the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the diligent <S%H9167><s%> is made <S%H1878><s%> fat. <S%H1878><s%>

A righteous <S%H6662><s%> man <S%H6662><s%> hates <S%H8130><s%> falsehood, <S%H8267><s%> But a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H7563><s%> acts <S%H887><s%> disgustingly <S%H887><s%> and shamefully. <S%H2659><s%>
Righteousness <S%H6666><s%> guards <S%H5341><s%> the one whose way <S%H1870><s%> is blameless, <S%H8537><s%> But wickedness <S%H7564><s%> subverts <S%H5557><s%> the sinner. <S%H9128><s%>

There <S%H3426><s%> is one who pretends <S%H6238><s%> to be rich, <S%H6238><s%> but has <S%H369><s%> nothing <S%H369><s%>; <S%H3605><s%> [Another] pretends <S%H7326><s%> to be poor, <S%H7326><s%> but has great <S%H7227><s%> wealth. <S%H1952><s%>
The ransom <S%H3724><s%> of a man's life <S%H5315><s%> is his riches, <S%H6239><s%> But the poor <S%H7326><s%> hears <S%H8085><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> rebuke. <S%H1606><s%>
The light <S%H216><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> rejoices, <S%H8055><s%> But the lamp <S%H5216><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> goes <S%H1846><s%> out.
Through presumption <S%H2087><s%> comes <S%H5414><s%> nothing <S%H7534><s%> but strife, <S%H4683><s%> But with those who receive <S%H3289><s%> counsel <S%H3289><s%> is wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
Wealth <S%H1952><s%> [obtained] by fraud <S%H1892><s%> dwindles, <S%H4591><s%> But the one who gathers <S%H6908><s%> by labor <S%H3027><s%> increases <S%H7235><s%> [it.]

Hope <S%H8431><s%> deferred <S%H4900><s%> makes <S%H2470><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%> sick, <S%H2470><s%> But desire <S%H8378><s%> fulfilled <S%H935><s%> is a tree <S%H6086><s%> of life. <S%H9132><s%>
The one who despises <S%H936><s%> the word <S%H1697><s%> will be in debt <S%H9111><s%> to it, But the one who fears <S%H3372><s%> the commandment <S%H4687><s%> will be rewarded. <S%H9608><s%>
The teaching <S%H8451><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> is a fountain <S%H4726><s%> of life, <S%H9132><s%> To turn <S%H5493><s%> aside <S%H5493><s%> from the snares <S%H4170><s%> of death. <S%H4194><s%>
Good <S%H2896><s%> understanding <S%H7922><s%> produces <S%H5414><s%> favor, <S%H2580><s%> But the way <S%H1870><s%> of the treacherous <S%H898><s%> is hard. <S%H386><s%>
Every <S%H3605><s%> prudent <S%H6175><s%> man <S%H6175><s%> acts <S%H6213><s%> with knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> But a fool <S%H3684><s%> displays <S%H6566><s%> folly. <S%H200><s%>
A wicked <S%H7563><s%> messenger <S%H4397><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> into adversity, <S%H9563><s%> But a faithful <S%H529><s%> envoy <S%H6735><s%> [brings] healing. <S%H4832><s%>

Poverty <S%H7389><s%> and shame <S%H7036><s%> [will come] to him who neglects <S%H6544><s%> discipline, <S%H4148><s%> But he who regards <S%H8104><s%> reproof <S%H9640><s%> will be honored. <S%H3513><s%>

Desire <S%H8378><s%> realized <S%H1961><s%> is sweet <S%H6149><s%> to the soul, <S%H5315><s%> But it is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to fools <S%H3684><s%> to depart <S%H5493><s%> from evil. <S%H9563><s%>
He who walks <S%H1980><s%> with wise <S%H2450><s%> men <S%H2450><s%> will be wise, <S%H2449><s%> But the companion <S%H9565><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%> will suffer <S%H7489><s%> harm. <S%H7489><s%>
Adversity <S%H9567><s%> pursues <S%H7291><s%> sinners, <S%H2400><s%> But the righteous <S%H6662><s%> will be rewarded <S%H9608><s%> with prosperity. <S%H9185><s%>

A good <S%H2896><s%> man <S%H2896><s%> leaves <S%H5157><s%> an inheritance <S%H5157><s%> to his children <S%H1121><s%>'s children, And the wealth <S%H2428><s%> of the sinner <S%H2398><s%> is stored <S%H6845><s%> up for the righteous. <S%H6662><s%>

Abundant <S%H7230><s%> food <S%H400><s%> [is in] the fallow <S%H5215><s%> ground <S%H5215><s%> of the poor, <S%H7326><s%> But it is swept <S%H5595><s%> away <S%H5595><s%> by injustice. <S%H3808><s%> <S%H4941><s%>
He who spares <S%H2820><s%> his rod <S%H7626><s%> hates <S%H8130><s%> his son, <S%H1121><s%> But he who loves <S%H157><s%> him disciplines <S%H4148><s%> him diligently. <S%H7836><s%>

The righteous <S%H6662><s%> has <S%H398><s%> enough <S%H398><s%> to satisfy <S%H7648><s%> his appetite, <S%H5315><s%> But the stomach <S%H990><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is in want. <S%H2637><s%>
